page.title: 13DARTMOUTH: NOSS WORKS
page.content: Interest has been shown in a{Port {Development}within the ancient harbour of Dartmouth for some years. The proposed port at{Noss Creek}would provide a modern fish quay for the local{fishing industry}as well as facilities for handling containers, dry bulk, near bulk and general cargo. The depth of water at berth is 10m. suitable for vessels of up to 7,000 tonnes. Its main impact to Dartmouth would be that of providing{employment for 83 people directly and 205 people in associated businesses. It is estimated that it would cost about{Â£6,000,000}but would have an expected turnover of Â£1,750,000 within 2 years and Â£3,500,000 in 5 years. Dartmouth is on a primary{trade {route}for sea traffic moving along the English Channel with connections to the main trunk roads to{London.
